explanation: formal; a thing that causes disgust and hatred, or is considered extremely offensive
sentence: Cruelty to animals is an abomination.
sentence_gap: Cruelty to animals is an ___________.

explanation: providing necessary support to the main work or activities of an organization
sentence: Campaigning to change government policy is ancillary to the charity's direct relief work.
sentence_gap: Campaigning to change government policy is _________ to the charity's direct relief work.

explanation: extreme unhappiness caused by physical or mental suffering
sentence: His anguish at the outcome of the court case was very clear.
sentence_gap: His _______ at the outcome of the court case was very clear.

explanation: a piece of clothing that you wear over the front of other clothes to keep the clothes clean while you are doing something dirty, such as cooking or cleaning
sentence: Cade shook his head and with a quick move, untied her apron strings.
sentence_gap: Cade shook his head and with a quick move, untied her _____ strings.

explanation: to prevent something bad from happening
sentence: A disaster was narrowly averted.
sentence_gap: A disaster was narrowly _______.

explanation: a mark that spoils the appearance of someone or something
sentence: Is any politician's record without blemish on this issue?
sentence_gap: Is any politician's record without _______ on this issue?

explanation: quick, energetic, and active
sentence: He set a brisk pace and we struggled to keep up.
sentence_gap: He set a _____ pace and we struggled to keep up.

explanation: the general state of someone's health
sentence: He has a very strong constitution.
sentence_gap: He has a very strong ____________.

explanation: to deal successfully with a difficult situation
sentence: It must be really hard to cope with three young children and a job.
sentence_gap: It must be really hard to ____ with three young children and a job.

explanation: formal; a person's face or their expression
sentence: He was of noble countenance.
sentence_gap: He was of noble ___________.

explanation: old-fashioned or formal; the time when people have a romantic relationship with the intention of getting married
sentence: They had a passionate courtship and a long, loving marriage.
sentence_gap: They had a passionate _________ and a long, loving marriage.

explanation: formal; a strong desire for more wealth, possessions, power, etc. than a person needs
sentence: These men again and again condemn cupidity in the rich, and appeal to precisely the same feelings in the poor.
sentence_gap: These men again and again condemn ________ in the rich, and appeal to precisely the same feelings in the poor.

explanation: certainly and obviously
sentence: An agreement is looking decidedly difficult according to the newspapers.
sentence_gap: An agreement is looking _________ difficult according to the newspapers.

explanation: formal; a strong difference of opinion on a particular subject, especially about an official suggestion or plan or a popular belief
sentence: When the time came to approve the proposal, there were one or two voices of dissent.
sentence_gap: When the time came to approve the proposal, there were one or two voices of _______.

explanation: to fall in small drops
sentence: Water was dripping down the walls.
sentence_gap: Water was ________ down the walls.

explanation: the period of time when the ocean flows away from the land
sentence: He had known her long enough to recognize the ebb and flow of her moods.
sentence_gap: He had known her long enough to recognize the ___ and flow of her moods.

explanation: to make something more beautiful by adding something to it; to add or change some details of a story, usually to make it more interesting or exciting
sentence: He couldn't resist embellishing the story of his accident a little.
sentence_gap: He couldn't resist ____________ the story of his accident a little.

explanation: (disapproving) to firmly establish something, especially an idea or a problem, so that it cannot be changed
sentence: This idea had firmly entrenched itself in his consciousness.
sentence_gap: This idea had firmly __________ itself in his consciousness.

explanation: formal; connected with horses, or appearing similar to a horse
sentence: The portraits showed an aristocratic family with long equine faces.
sentence_gap: The portraits showed an aristocratic family with long ______ faces.

explanation: formal; respect for or a good opinion of someone
sentence: There has been a drop in public esteem for teachers.
sentence_gap: There has been a drop in public ______ for teachers.

explanation: to get something by force or threats, or with difficulty
sentence: He had been extorting money from the old lady for years.
sentence_gap: He had been _________ money from the old lady for years.

explanation: informal; to confuse someone so much that they do not know what to do
sentence: I was flummoxed by her question.
sentence_gap: I was _________ by her question.

explanation: any substance that is used as food or to make food
sentence: They lack basic foodstuffs, such as bread and milk.
sentence_gap: They lack basic __________, such as bread and milk.

explanation: very thin, especially because of sickness or hunger
sentence: Her face was gaunt and grey.
sentence_gap: Her face was _____ and grey.

explanation: to produce small, bright flashes of light reflected from a surface
sentence: A large diamond glinted on her finger.
sentence_gap: A large diamond _______ on her finger.

explanation: the quality of appearing very attractive, exciting, and impressive, in a way that is not always genuine
sentence: The party's electoral message may be obscured by the glitz and glamor of its presentation.
sentence_gap: The party's electoral message may be obscured by the _____ and glamor of its presentation.

explanation: disapproving; (of something such as bad behavior) not necessary, or with no cause
sentence: A lot of viewers complained that there was too much gratuitous sex and violence in the film.
sentence_gap: A lot of viewers complained that there was too much __________ sex and violence in the film.

explanation: the area around a fireplace or the area of floor in front of it
sentence: A bright fire was burning in the hearth.
sentence_gap: A bright fire was burning in the ______.

explanation: approving; perfectly clean and tidy or in perfect condition
sentence: He gave an immaculate performance as the aging hero.
sentence_gap: He gave an __________ performance as the aging hero.

explanation: (disapproving or humorous) having bad habits that cannot be changed or improved
sentence: Her husband is an incorrigible flirt.
sentence_gap: Her husband is an ____________ flirt.

explanation: a detail that is part of something complicated
sentence: Another consequence of high-level programming is a loss of control over the intricacies of program execution.
sentence_gap: Another consequence of high-level programming is a loss of control over the ___________ of program execution.

explanation: the loose skin and flesh under the jaw
sentence: Karay was a shaggy old dog with a hanging jowl, famous for having tackled a big wolf unaided.
sentence_gap: Karay was a shaggy old dog with a hanging ____, famous for having tackled a big wolf unaided.

explanation: large in amount, or impressive, and usually costing a lot of money
sentence: They rebuilt the house on an even more lavish scale than before.
sentence_gap: They rebuilt the house on an even more ______ scale than before.

sentence: Lead pipes in many older houses have been replaced by copper ones.
sentence_gap: ____ pipes in many older houses have been replaced by copper ones.

explanation: a speech fault in which the sound “s” is pronounced “th”
sentence: She spoke with a slight lisp.
sentence_gap: She spoke with a slight ____.

explanation: stupid behavior that will have bad results
sentence: It would be lunacy to try to climb the mountain in this weather.
sentence_gap: It would be ______ to try to climb the mountain in this weather.

explanation: bad luck, or an unlucky event or accident
sentence: The parade was very well organized and passed without mishap.
sentence_gap: The parade was very well organized and passed without ______.

explanation: to touch or attack someone in a sexual way against their wishes
sentence: The girl had been molested frequently by her stepfather from the age of eight.
sentence_gap: The girl had been ________ frequently by her stepfather from the age of eight.

explanation: formal; (especially of ideas) not clear and having no form
sentence: She has a few nebulous ideas about what she might want to do in the future, but nothing definite.
sentence_gap: She has a few ________ ideas about what she might want to do in the future, but nothing definite.

explanation: unwilling to be generous with money, time, etc.
sentence: Forced by hunger, he worked for the most niggardly pay.
sentence_gap: Forced by hunger, he worked for the most _________ pay.

explanation: formal disapproving; trying too hard to please someone, especially someone who is important
sentence: She is embarrassingly obsequious to anyone in authority.
sentence_gap: She is embarrassingly __________ to anyone in authority.

explanation: far away from the cities of a country or from the main part of a place
sentence: Many of the students travel in by bus from outlying areas.
sentence_gap: Many of the students travel in by bus from ________ areas.

explanation: to be greater or more important than something else
sentence: The benefits of this treatment far outweigh any risks.
sentence_gap: The benefits of this treatment far ________ any risks.

explanation: a long piece of land that sticks out from a larger area of land into the sea or into a lake
sentence: The forms of life characteristic of India and the Malay peninsula come down to the island of Bali.
sentence_gap: The forms of life characteristic of India and the Malay _________ come down to the island of Bali.

explanation: an animal that hunts, kills, and eats other animals
sentence: Some animals have no natural predators.
sentence_gap: Some animals have no natural _________.

explanation: formal; the fact that someone likes something or likes to do something, especially something considered morally wrong
sentence: Anna was very worried about her son going to kindergarten because he has a proclivity to misbehave.
sentence_gap: Anna was very worried about her son going to kindergarten because he has a __________ to misbehave.

explanation: formal; the state of being near in space or time
sentence: The proximity of the college to a big city makes it very popular.
sentence_gap: The _________ of the college to a big city makes it very popular.

explanation: to drink liquid so that you stop being thirsty; to use water to put out a fire
sentence: The flames were quenched by heavy rain.
sentence_gap: The flames were ________ by heavy rain.

explanation: formal; to stop yourself from doing something, especially something that you want to do
sentence: He has refrained from criticizing the government in public.
sentence_gap: He has _________ from criticizing the government in public.

explanation: a feeling of anger because you have been forced to accept something that you do not like
sentence: This decision has caused resentment among some teachers.
sentence_gap: This decision has caused __________ among some teachers.

explanation: to move quickly, with small, short steps, especially in order to escape
sentence: A crab scuttled away under a rock as we passed.
sentence_gap: A crab ________ away under a rock as we passed.

explanation: literary; pressed closely together, usually in lines
sentence: We flew over the city with its serried ranks of identical grey houses.
sentence_gap: We flew over the city with its _______ ranks of identical grey houses.

explanation: to break or separate, especially by cutting; to end a connection with someone or something
sentence: The US severed diplomatic relations with Cuba in 1961.
sentence_gap: The US _______ diplomatic relations with Cuba in 1961.

explanation: a number of things, especially pieces of paper or plant stems, that are held or tied together
sentence: The corn was cut and tied in sheaves.
sentence_gap: The corn was cut and tied in _______.

explanation: to fall in price, value, number, etc., suddenly and by a large amount
sentence: Sales have slumped this year.
sentence_gap: Sales have _______ this year.

explanation: to take things or people to or from a place secretly and often illegally
sentence: They managed to smuggle a video of the captive journalists out of the prison.
sentence_gap: They managed to _______ a video of the captive journalists out of the prison.

explanation: (especially of remarks) containing unpleasant criticism that is not clearly stated
sentence: She made one or two snide remarks about their house, which I thought was a bit unnecessary.
sentence_gap: She made one or two _____ remarks about their house, which I thought was a bit unnecessary.

explanation: to drop small drops of liquid, etc. on a surface, or (of liquid) to fall, especially noisily, in small drops
sentence: Two bikes raced by and spattered mud over our clothes.
sentence_gap: Two bikes raced by and _________ mud over our clothes.

explanation: the sound of something hitting liquid or of liquid hitting something
sentence: We heard the splash when she fell into the pool.
sentence_gap: We heard the ______ when she fell into the pool.

explanation: (of water or air) not flowing or moving, and smelling unpleasant
sentence: Few fish survive in the stagnant waters of the lake.
sentence_gap: Few fish survive in the ________ waters of the lake.

explanation: disapproving; a position of complete control that prevents something from developing
sentence: The two major companies have been tightening their stranglehold on the beer market.
sentence_gap: The two major companies have been tightening their ____________ on the beer market.

explanation: to walk in a slow relaxed way, especially for pleasure
sentence: We could stroll along the beach after dinner.
sentence_gap: We could ______ along the beach after dinner.

explanation: (especially of animals) not wild or dangerous, either naturally or because of training or long involvement with humans
sentence: After a few months' contact the monkeys become very tame.
sentence_gap: After a few months' contact the monkeys become very ____.

explanation: to intentionally annoy and upset someone by making unkind remarks to them, laughing unkindly at them, etc.
sentence: The youngest in the group was taunted mercilessly.
sentence_gap: The youngest in the group was _______ mercilessly.

explanation: a fight or argument, especially between two people who want the same thing
sentence: He was injured during a tussle for the ball.
sentence_gap: He was injured during a ______ for the ball.

explanation: remaining strong; not becoming weak or tired
sentence: She had shown unflagging support for the cause.
sentence_gap: She had shown __________ support for the cause.

explanation: one of the small bones that form the spine
sentence: The vertebra has a neural canal less than half the diameter of the centrum.
sentence_gap: The ________ has a neural canal less than half the diameter of the centrum.

sentence: The vipers slithered and hissed.
sentence_gap: The ______ slithered and hissed.

explanation: formal; language that is full of hate, or angry criticism
sentence: No one else attracted such vituperation from him.
sentence_gap: No one else attracted such ____________ from him.

explanation: to become weaker in strength or influence
sentence: By the late 70s the band's popularity was beginning to wane.
sentence_gap: By the late 70s the band's popularity was beginning to ____.
